stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Robin
[Gender] Female
[Bodyguard Experience] 3 Years
[Place of Birth] Columbia
[Date of Birth] May 18
[Race] Anaty
[Height] 155cm
[Infection Status]
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Normal
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Former Columbian bodyguard, passed examination and joined Rhodes Island on Operator Silence's referral.
Expert at remote lethality in coordination with homemade traps. Presently active in the gamut of missions as a Specialist Operator.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Robin shows no signs of Originium infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.12u/L
Operator Robin rarely comes into contact with Originium.

A fairly reticent Anaty woman.
Perpetually downcast between her brows, she gives the impression that much weighs on her mind, though she gives her own explanation for it—in keeping her household afloat, she often considers a great deal of things, and has gotten used to it.
Talking to her, you realize that she's just the same as a city girl who likes to be with people her age.

After finding out about Robin's father's circumstances, Rhodes Island notified its Columbian office's operators to go and look into it.
Robin's father was in dire condition to say the least, and Rhodes Island was already hard-pressed to offer Robin treatment free of charge. There are too many suffering across this world, and Rhodes Island is no charity.
However, as long as both sides have ideas, then there is always some leeway for mediation. In the end, Rhodes Island issued for Robin a fairly particular contract—much longer work hours than other Operators, with a further predetermined cut of all of Robin's mission earnings paid automatically to Rhodes Island, directly furnishing her father's medical fees.
In return, Rhodes Island would immediately provide her father treatment.

Many Operators aboard Rhodes Island have complicated backgrounds. It's led to the point that if you stopped and paid attention to the chatter, you'd be forgiven for thinking we were in an age of chaos and flames of war.
But if you set aside the effect of Oripathy, you'd find most people across the land living in peace, all the while enjoying the eclectic conveniences of modernization—it's a cruel thing, but if only the vast wealth of cities disregarded the conflict stemming from Infected and the like, wouldn't things seem so peaceful?
Not to tread a time-worn supposition again; the point is that a portion of Rhodes Island's operators have, owing to their years of combat experience, been rather long estranged from modern life.
This is no good thing; a certain amount of recreation is indispensable, and Rhodes Island hardly restricts its operators' private lives. Yet, people continually lapped by the fire of conflict find it no easy thing to return to everyday life. Their greatest joys will often be confined to liquor, music, reading, and sleep.
People like the ever-freewheeling Chief Engineer Closure are few and far between across Rhodes Island, and on more than one occasion she's been frustrated at not finding someone of like mind to have fun watching movies and soaps together.
Robin's arrival alleviated one of her problems; after all, just as the first record states, Robin is by no means naturally gloomy—she was undeniably an open, cheerful city girl in the past, and her greatest hobby happens to be watching movies.

According to our Columbian operators' investigations and Robin's own explanation, it was only following the bankruptcy of her father's company and his repeated failures to reprise that he entered a downwards spiral.
At the time of his divorce, the option to go with her mother was wholly open to Robin, but she chose to stay by her father's side in the end.
She says that even though her father became so violent, easy to enrage, she still remembers how he used to be so gentle. So she opted to bear her father's hysteria, all the while heading out alone, earning money by herself to keep the house going.
In spite of her relatively light build, she looked up to the robust, talented protagonists she'd seen since childhood in movies, and so when times at home were good, she took martial arts classes, and by her own efforts built up a good physique, as well as impressive combat skill for any ordinary person. Though adulthood came and she was nothing close to a hero who could plumb Paradise and Inferno alike, it did streamline finding herself a job.
She first tried to pursue mental labor, but she quickly realized such work couldn't support her father's spendthrift habits. Afterwards, she began seeking all sorts of physical work, and ultimately found a decent job as a bodyguard.
The job, however, was barely enough to maintain their livelihood, and she still sought better-paying work all throughout. Moreover, Robin has made it clear that during that period, how dangerous the work was no longer mattered much to her, as long as it could make any money.
Indeed, she never imagined it'd be a turning point from where she'd meet Mountain and Silence, and eventually come to Rhodes Island.
In the end, even if her father can recover with Rhodes Island's aid, even greater problems will sooner or later arise should he fall back on his older self-abandoning ways, and it's clear that Robin would be powerless against them.
Though it often doesn't end well when outsiders interfere in these types of domestic affairs, Robin herself has turned to the Doctor and asked for help, so it should be feasible at the least for the Doctor to offer her some suggestion of direction.
We hope for a day when things can improve for her.

[Classified Log]
Anthony raised something with me, concerning Robin's mid-jailbreak 'betrayal.'
He knows of it, Kafka knows, and in order to explain the jailbreak's events, he's told Silence and Mayer of it. Beyond that, though, he hasn't gone out of his way to tell Domma or Pinecone, and he hopes the two of them will never, ever know the jailbreak saw something like it happen.
He also hopes, if there comes a day when he's made known to the world, that this specific matter isn't raised.
I have no reason to refuse.
That said, Robin still seems to be taking it quite deeply to heart, and this I can't help with. We can only watch to see if she, herself, can move on from it.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

<color name=#ffffff>EPOQUE Collection New Arrivals/Gift of Wild. The choice of the Columbian pioneer, with a core emphasis on strong and durable design. The added details give this outfit that extra personal touch.</color>

skills.desc:
Passive Effect: When a trap is triggered, deals <@ba.vup>{atk_scale:0%}</> ATK as Physical damage and <$ba.root>Binds</> the target for <@ba.vup>{constraint}</> second(s)
Active Effect: Immediately gets 1 trap

Passive Effect: When a trap is triggered, deals <@ba.vup>{atk_scale:0%}</> ATK as Physical damage and pushes the target away <@ba.vup>significantly</>
Active Effect: Immediately gets 1 trap

modules.desc:
Operator Robin has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for battlefield ambush and trap deployment.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Specialist Operator during field operations to exercise Trapmaster responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

1/3
UPCOMING: going to watch judge's pen vs. ironzoid with closure. NOTES: so wacky all the way through i couldn't stop laughing. intense fun. maybe i should start watching more lungmen movies.
1/15
saw whisperain in screening room. we watched satan's flamenco, long movie. real long, but hugely immersive experience.
...
2/14
UPCOMING: rewatching the lone hitman, alone. NOTES: yeah watching other people's romances suits me better.
...
3/2
UPCOMING: on field mission. NOTES: infected are in crazy bad situation... want to do something for them somehow.
...
3/11
UPCOMING: got advanced training for specialist operators. NOTES: ton of crazy powerful people... kind of scary.
...
4/17
UPCOMING: visit pop on the way to mission. NOTES: pop is still something vicious, but the operator lady nursing him told me he's been all secretly saving up the money i've sent him.
...
5/18
birthday. NOTES: domma made a birthday cake for me, mountain + kafka came too. we all watched the childhood of selyosha, old movie i really like. kafka slipped out midway, but still, made me really happy.
...
6/12
UPCOMING: hd restoration screening of the 500 blows, you bet i'm going to the theater. NOTES: amazing. had basically whole theater to myself. people really don't get old movies!
...
7/10
UPCOMING: field mission. NOTES: saw mom in a city i did not expect at all. she had this huge smile on her. i didn't go say hello.
...
9/30
UPCOMING: hosting a screening event with closure and whisperain. it's gonna be good.
...
12/31
UPCOMING: going to rhodes new year party. getting to know people, broadening my horizons, that's me now.
—In the space where the Doctor's birthday lands, she's drawn in a huge smiley face.

voice_lines.voiceText: Doctor, anything I should help with?
Doctor, you're always so busy with work. Don't you have any hobbies? Me, I like watching obscure old movies.

Truth is, I learned how to fight because of this movie I saw when I was little. Main character fought with knives and homemade traps. I thought it was really cool, so I started learning myself. My knives here, they're actually the same kind as the ones in that movie.
In Columbia, anything can be bought with money. It sounds great, until you turn it around: Without money, nothing's yours at all.
Rhodes Island feels like a company out of a movie. Medical corp on the outside, actually a private army underneath. Operating to save more and more people… feels pretty cool.
Doctor, do you think I come off gloomy? Dammit… I didn't used to be like this. It was ever since my pop got the way he did, and I had to start worrying about keeping the family afloat. Hmm…

I don't hate Anthony. If we have to talk about the past, I think my pop's to blame too. And honestly, I thank Anthony. If he wasn't in the right place at the right time, I might've done something... I could never take back.
Pop never understood. Mom didn't leave because we had no money. It was 'cause his temper got worse every day. I've thought about if I went with Mom instead, but Pop used to be... so nice to me.

Doctor, there's times I'm with you and I ease up so much I forget my own issues. I have the money to treat my pop's illness now, but I don't have a cure for his emotional troubles… Doctor, could you help me?
So you get tired and drop right where you are, just like me…
Nice to meet you, Doctor. I'm a new Operator. Robin's the name. I've got money troubles, so if it's all the same to you, just send me to do whatever.
Intense. Feels just like I'm watching an action movie...
What? I got a raise so quick...? That's great. Thank you, Doctor!
I never stuck with my old jobs for very long. The company itself had problems, or it was something with my pop... This time, it feels like I'll be able to stick with Rhodes Island for a long time.
Leave it to me.
I'm not too good at teamwork…
Wonder what kind of place we're going to this time.
Let's take a look around first…
Am I up?
Ready. Just say the word.
I see the enemy.
Mm.
I've got a temper too!
Hmph.
Where are you looking?
I've got more than just knives!
Doctor, can we cut this sort of mission down a little? Bad for the heart…
I bet everybody dreams of having a boss like you, Doctor.
Doctor, need me to chase them?
Doctor, you go! I'll cover you!
I better get to know this place…
Um?
Doctor. Taking a walk?
Arknights.
'The happiest thing about today is we say goodbye to the past; the hardest thing about today is we say goodbye to the memories.' It's, uh, a line from a movie... Umm, Happy New Year, Doctor.
Doctor. Need me to guard you today?

Doctor, happy birthday. I got a necklace for you. It's from my movie tie-in collection. Comes from a real classic romance flick. But now I'm, uh, remembering what happens to the ship and the lead couple, and it sends kind of a crappy message... Umm, please forget what I said. Just treat it like a normal necklace, okay?

My pop's sickness eased up a little. I'm thankful—really, truly, I am... I gotta be honest though, I know with my abilities I don't deserve this contract. The most I can do is repay Rhodes Island for helping us, however I can. Just, I can start by protecting you, Doctor. That's experience I've got under my belt, as a bodyguard.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to be the Trainer in the Training Room, <@cc.kw>Specialist</> Operators' Specialization training speed <@cc.vup>+30%</>

When this Operator is assigned to be the Trainer in the Training Room, <@cc.kw>Specialist</> Operators' Specialization training speed <@cc.vup>+30%</>; if training this skill to Specialization Level <@cc.vup>1</>, training speed will be further increased by <@cc.vup>+45%</>
